items.title: War and peace: Ukrainians share their wish for 2026; hope for 'hell' to end
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK

items.title: ?Leader of rare resolve?: What PM Modi wrote to Khaleda Zia?s son Tarique Rahman
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK

items.title: Explained: Who is Alaa Abd el-Fattah, and why is his return to the UK making headlines
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK
items.description: Alaa Abd el-Fattah, once a symbol of Arab Spring idealism, now faces controversy in the UK after his release from Egyptian prison. His return ignited debate over old social media posts and the vetting process for his British citizenship. This episode highlights the complex challenges liberal democracies face when balancing humanitarian advocacy with national security.

items.title: Goa nightclub fire: Illegal salt pan structure, collusion with officials; what probe report revealed
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: A magisterial inquiry found a Goa nightclub, where 25 died in a fire, was illegally built on a salt pan and operated without valid permissions. Systemic failures and alleged collusion by local authorities were highlighted, as the village panchayat issued a license despite it not being renewed, allowing the club to continue functioning.

items.title: Cong slams arrest of Nagpur Christian priest; demands action against Bajrang Dal
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: Congress has slammed the BJP following the arrest of a Christian priest and 11 others in Nagpur during a prayer meeting, accusing the party of religious bigotry.  MP KC Venugopal and Kerala LoP VD Satheesan condemned the arrests, demanding the FIR be withdrawn and calling for action against Bajrang Dal activists. They highlighted concerns over minority rights and constitutional freedoms.

items.title: Karbi Anglong violence: Assam oppn seeks rehabilitation of victims; demads judicial probe
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: Opposition parties in Assam have urged the governor for rehabilitation and compensation for families impacted by recent West Karbi Anglong violence. They demand upholding tribal land rights and fair treatment for all affected communities. The memorandum also calls for a judicial probe into the alleged destruction of evidence at the chief executive member's residence.

items.title: Spreading 'falsehood' against Modi govt: Nadda hits out at Kharge
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: BJP chief J.P. Nadda accused Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge of spreading falsehoods against the Modi government. Nadda refuted Kharge's allegations on MGNREGA, economy, and environmental issues, stating the people have rejected Congress's lies in multiple elections. He urged Kharge to introspect instead of spreading misinformation.

items.title: Earthquake in Japan: Magnitude 6 quake jolts East of Noda; no immediate casualties
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK

items.title: Bengal polls 2026: Shah sets ground rules for BJP cadre; pushes grassroots drive
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has urged BJP representatives in West Bengal to intensify grassroots outreach, dedicating at least four days weekly to constituencies and holding daily street-corner meetings. He emphasized performance for ticket consideration and signaled a renewed role for former state chief Dilip Ghosh in the upcoming assembly elections.

items.title: Set to be NYC mayor: Zohran Mamdani to assume office on New Year?s Da
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK
items.description: Zohran Mamdani will be sworn in as New York City's new mayor on New Year's Day with two ceremonies. The first, a private family oath at the historic City Hall subway station, will be administered by Attorney General Letitia James. A public celebration with a second oath on the steps of City Hall, led by Senator Bernie Sanders, will follow.

items.title: VHT: Sarfaraz Khan slams 75-ball 157; Mumbai post 444, beat Goa by 87 runs
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: Sarfaraz, who was also among the runs in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, brought up a century off 56 balls, his third hundred in List A cricket. Mumbai piled up 444 for 8 and then limited Goa to 357 for 9.

items.title: Max Scherzer & Erica May-Scherzer?s 2025 net worth: Inside $180m empire
items.author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
items.description: Max Scherzer, the formidable MLB pitcher, has amassed a $180 million net worth by 2025, a testament to his on-field dominance and shrewd financial planning. His career earnings are bolstered by strategic contracts and selective endorsements. Wife Erica May-Scherzer, a former player, significantly contributes to their philanthropic endeavors and family's financial stability.

items.title: Ayesha Curry?s 'A+ wife move' for Stephen Curry goes viral online
items.author: SONAM PRASAD
items.description: Ayesha Curry recently garnered widespread praise from fans for wearing her husband Stephen Curry's Davidson jersey during a visit to his alma mater. This heartwarming gesture, seen during a tribute to the NBA star, effectively silenced recent marriage rumors. Fans lauded her unwavering support and loyalty, highlighting the couple's strong bond.

items.title: ?New chapter? ahead: Bangladesh envoy on EAM's Dhaka visit; signals positive tone for bilateral ties
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK

items.title: US-based Doctor?s eye-opening post flags unsettling health reality of 2025
items.author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
items.description: The year 2025 revealed health dangers beyond viruses. Extreme longevity proved detrimental. Air pollution impacted lungs and health year-round. Mental burnout caused physical harm. Isolation posed risks similar to smoking. Fitness obsessions led to injuries. Heat waves became deadly. Sleep debt damaged brains. AI questioned medical ethics. Health anxiety replaced tracking. Balance, not extremes, is the future.

items.title: Why Sensex, Nifty underperformed in 2025 & where are they headed in 2026? Top points
items.author: SHIVANGHI PAYAL
items.description: Indian equities lagged global markets in 2025 due to muted corporate earnings, FII selling, and missed AI rally. Despite touching record highs, broader market sentiment remained subdued. Experts anticipate a stronger 2026, driven by domestic growth, potential FII return, and improved valuations, with Nifty and Sensex targets set higher.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Explained: How the Israel issue is splintering MAGA
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Once a bedrock of Republican consensus, support for Israel is fracturing within the MAGA movement. This ideological split, fueled by generational, theological, and ideological differences, exposes fault lines and a disturbing rise in antisemitic rhetoric. The future of the right hinges on how this conflict over Israel is resolved.

items.title: VHT: Pant fails ahead of NZ ODI series selection; Odisha hand Delhi 1st defeat
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: Delhi?s campaign this season has largely depended on one strong batting effort in each game. The absence of such a performance on Wednesday not only cost them the match but also their position at the top of the points table, a setback that could affect them later in the tournament.

items.title: Jagannath temple pulls 2026 calendars: Image shows deities in incorrect positions; triggers backlash
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: The Jagannath temple administration in Puri has apologized and halted the sale of 2026 calendars after depicting the sibling deities in incorrect positions on the Ratna Singhasan. The administration attributed the error to a century-old manuscript, stating there was no intent to offend religious sentiments. Political parties criticized the inaccuracies, which also extended to the depiction of Rath Yatra chariots

items.title: Code to factory: Tech CEOs who went 'founder mode?; here's how they led the AI race
items.author: TOI TECH DESK
items.description: Tech leaders are entering 'Founder Mode' in 2025. CEOs like Sergey Brin, Satya Nadella, Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Brian Chesky are directly involved in their companies' AI strategies. They are making significant changes, from coding to restructuring, to win the AI race. This hands-on approach aims to secure future success in the rapidly evolving technology landscape.

items.title: ?Second fiddle? fantasy? Sorry, Beijing - US and India won't settle for silver
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: A new narrative suggests China will lead, with the US and India vying for second. Analyst Keji Mao argues US "strategic altruism" towards India has ended due to American decline anxiety. However, the article counters that US decline is exaggerated, China's economic rise faces headwinds, and India is forging an independent path, leading to a complex, contested global order.

items.title: Iran unrest: Governor?s office attacked as protests turn violent; video
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK

items.title: NFL trade rumours: Joe Burrow to Jets as Bengals land Fernando Mendoza
items.author: DR. ARATI KULKARNI SRIVASTAVA
items.description: A wild NFL trade rumor suggests the Bengals could acquire Heisman winner Fernando Mendoza, potentially using Joe Burrow to secure five first-round picks from the Jets. While fans dismiss the idea, Mendoza's potential as a top prospect and the Bengals' defensive needs are explored. Burrow's massive contract complicates any such hypothetical move.

items.title: India?US ties: Embassy shares key moments of 2025; eyes stronger year ahead
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: The US Embassy in India celebrated a year of robust bilateral ties, highlighting key moments like Prime Minister Modi's meeting with President Trump and the signing of a major defense pact.  Discussions also covered space collaboration and leadership exchanges, underscoring a commitment to strengthening the partnership despite global challenges. Both nations look forward to continued cooperation.

items.title: Big relief for consumers! IGL cuts piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCR; check new rates
items.author: TOI BUSINESS DESK

items.title: India?s ODI squad vs NZ: Gill to lead; Bumrah and Pandya likely to be rested
items.author: GAURAV GUPTA
items.description: The Indian squad for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand will be selected on January 3. The series begins on January 11 in Vadodara. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to feature. Shubman Gill will lead the team. Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah may be rested for workload management. Dhruv Jurel is a potential wicketkeeper choice.

items.title: Stefon Diggs? viral proposal rehearsal sparks buzz amid Cardi B backlash
items.author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
items.description: A viral video of Stefon Diggs appearing to propose to Cardi B on the field, later revealed as him fixing her gear, has reignited public interest in their relationship. This comes amid Cardi B addressing online criticism and Diggs facing felony assault charges, which he denies. The Patriots support him as the legal process unfolds.

items.title: New Labour codes: Draft rules out - how will salary, gratuity, allowances be calculated? Explained
items.author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
items.description: New Labour Codes: The Ministry of labour has released the draft labour codes on December 31, 2025. The new rules and a set of FAQs clarify wage, gratuity, allowances calculation. We take a look:

items.title: Watch: Jalen Hurts? standout season goes viral as Eagles QB meets Jacklyn Romano
items.author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
items.description: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts was recently seen in a casual Instagram video with fitness influencer Jacklyn Romano, sporting matching tennis-style outfits. This off-field moment garnered attention during the Eagles' successful season, which culminated in Hurts being named Super Bowl MVP after leading his team to victory.

items.title: ?Reunification of our motherland unstoppable?: Xi?s message as Taiwan drills end; region on edge
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK

items.title: CEO Scott Tannen's 7 cues that quietly tell employers you walked in casually
items.author: TOI Education
items.description: Scott Tannen, CEO of Boll & Branch, uses one early interview question to test seriousness. Candidates who cannot explain the company reveal more than ignorance?they signal indifference. Here, we examine the seven subtle cues that tell employers you came unprepared, and why curiosity, context and intent now separate strong applicants from the rest.

items.title: Pralay missile test: India conducts successful salvo launch off Odisha coast - watch
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: India successfully conducted a salvo launch of two indigenously developed Pralay missiles off the coast of Odisha. The tests, conducted in quick succession from the same launcher, met all flight objectives, demonstrating the missile system's operational reliability and readiness for induction into the armed forces.

items.title: BBL: Car breaks down, Perth Scorchers players push Uber to stadium ? Watch
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: Laurie Evans, Ashton Agar, Aaron Hardie and Mahli Beardman were travelling to the stadium in an Uber when the car broke down on the way. With the vehicle coming to a halt, the four players stepped out and pushed it in an effort to restart it, before getting back in and continuing their journey to the ground.

items.title: BJP shares video of brutal assault on woman in West Bengal; slams CM Mamata
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: BJP shared a video showing a woman and her family being brutally attacked with bamboo sticks in Uttar Bhangnamari village, Basanti block, South 24 Parganas, West Bengal. The main accused named are Jalil Laskar, Munna Laskar, and Arif Laskar. BJP leaders, including Amit Malviya, criticized the state government, claiming the attack reflects a failure of law and order and a lack of safety for women in West Bengal.

items.title: ?Carefully planned?: Russia shares video of 'strike' on Putin residence; watch
items.author: TOI WORLD DESK

items.title: 'Don?t let them decide'- Ex-England captain's message to Khawaja on Test retirement
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: Former India opener Aakash Chopra backs Delhi Capitals to win the 2026 Women's Premier League. He also tips Royal Challengers Bengaluru captain Smriti Mandhana to dominate the batting charts and win the Orange Cap. Delhi Capitals' Shafali Verma is also a strong contender for the top run-scorer award.

items.title: From Coldplay to AQI and Dhurandhar ? What India talked about in 2025
items.author: KANCHAN YADAV
items.description: 2025 was a year of extremes for India, marked by the spiritual grandeur of the Maha Kumbh, a tragic stampede, and Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan's stabbing. The year also saw significant policy shifts like zero income tax up to Rs 12 lakh and a strong counter-terror response with Operation Sindoor following the Pahalgam attack.

items.title: Pandya power: All-rounder goes on rampage; helps Baroda put 417 in Vijay Hazare
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: The platform was laid by openers Nitya Pandya and Amit Pasi, who put together a 230-run stand for the first wicket. Nitya scored 122 from 110 balls, while Pasi made 127 from 93 deliveries, taking Hyderabad?s bowlers out of the game early.

items.title: Nimesulide painkiller ban: Centre bars oral formulations over 100 mg, cites health risks
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: The central government has imposed an immediate ban on the manufacture, sale and distribution of all oral formulations of the painkiller nimesulide containing more than 100 mg in immediate-release form, citing risks to human health and the availability of safer alternatives. The decision, taken under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act after expert consultation, was notified by the health ministry. Separately, the ministry proposed changes to the Drugs Rules, inviting public feedback within 30 days.

items.title: Head hopes to revive Ashes drinks tradition with Eng; why it broke down in 2023
items.author: TOI SPORTS DESK
items.description: Australian opener Travis Head expressed his hope for a return to the tradition of post-Ashes drinks between England and Australia.  He believes mutual respect exists despite past tensions, particularly after the Jonny Bairstow stumping incident in the 2023 series. Head looks forward to sharing a beer, highlighting the positive relationships between players on both sides.

items.title: 'Deepest condolences': EAM attends Khaleda Zia's funeral; hands PM Modi?s letter to son Tarique
items.author: TOI NEWS DESK
items.description: India's external affairs minister S Jaishankar conveyed Prime Minister Modi's condolences to BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman in Dhaka following the passing of former PM Begum Khaleda Zia. Jaishankar highlighted Zia's significant influence on India-Bangladesh ties and expressed optimism for future partnership development. India is officially participating in the funeral rites.

items.title: Trump's return, PM Modi's carpool & Pikachu: Images that defined world politics in 2025
items.author: KARAN MANRAL
items.description: 2025 was dominated by Donald Trump's return to the White House, with striking photographs capturing his inauguration and key diplomatic encounters. The year also saw significant moments like Trudeau's resignation, hostage releases, protests in Nepal, and strategic alliances forming between global leaders.

items.title: From memes to movements: How 2025 became the year of political awakening for Gen Z
items.author: RAJEEV SINGH
items.description: What began as side-eyeing governments for being ?pompous in power? escalated into calling them out, loudly and publicly. From campus corridors to capital streets, the Gen Z, largely mistaken as the ?nonchalants,? made it clear they were no longer willing to cope, stay low-key, or wait their turn. Across countries, young people discovered that turning up in person still mattered. That streets were not obsolete.

items.feedTitle: Pune News, Latest Pune News Headlines & Live Updates - Times of India
items.title: Pune-based Ayurvedacharya Dr Harish Patankar honoured with the International Ayurveda Ratna Award
items.author: Swati Shinde
items.description: Pune's Ayurvedacharya Dr. Harish Patankar received the prestigious International Ayurveda Ratna Award at the Second World Ayurveda Health Summit in Bengaluru. The award recognizes his extensive contributions to Ayurvedic practice, research, and education, and his global promotion of authentic Ayurveda. Dr. Patankar also delivered a lecture on applying classical Ayurvedic principles in modern clinical settings.

items.feedTitle: Pune News, Latest Pune News Headlines & Live Updates - Times of India
items.title: Maharashtra civic polls: Who is Amol Balwadkar? Ex-BJP leader joins Ajit Pawar?s NCP after ticket denial
items.author: Swati Shinde
items.description: Former BJP corporator Amol Balwadkar switched to the NCP after being denied a ticket at the last minute for the Pune civic polls. The NCP promptly fielded him, intensifying the election battle. Balwadkar expressed feeling betrayed by the BJP, vowing a "do-or-die fight." This move underscores internal BJP rifts and makes the contest more dynamic.

items.title: TOI Habit Index: India?s 2025 entertainment split - Netflix nights, reel breaks
items.author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
items.description: India's screen time is dominated by OTT content, with Netflix leading viewership. Short-form videos like reels also capture significant attention, driven by a desire for relaxation and entertainment. Viewers are increasingly aware of digital fatigue, aiming to reduce aimless scrolling and screen time.

items.title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
items.author: TOI TECH DESK
items.description: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

items.title: Aadhaar?PAN linking deadline ends today: How to link, penalty and other details
items.author: TOI TECH DESK
items.description: Linking your PAN card with Aadhaar is crucial to avoid penalties. The Income Tax department's portal guides you through a simple online process involving your PAN and Aadhaar numbers, followed by an OTP verification. Failure to link by December 31, 2025, will render your PAN inoperative, impacting tax refunds and leading to higher tax deductions and collections.

items.title: ?Calling H-1B workers ?invaders? is political theatre?: Viral post slams Florida governor on workforce data
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: A social media post challenges Florida Governor Ron DeSantis' immigration stance, refuting his 'invaders' label for H-1B workers. Citing workforce data, the post argues these skilled professionals fill critical labor gaps in Florida's booming economy, particularly in tech and healthcare. It emphasizes the visa program's strict regulations, countering the notion of open borders and highlighting the need for such talent.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Before Amazon, there was Toni Morrison: The mentor behind MacKenzie Scott?s $19 billion philanthropy
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Toni Morrison's mentorship profoundly shaped MacKenzie Scott's confidence and early career, influencing her path to Amazon and her current philanthropic approach. Scott has since donated over $19 billion, with a significant focus on Historically Black Colleges and Universities, echoing Morrison's lifelong commitments.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Extreme attempt to ?get high?: Woman injects black widow venom and ends up in ICU
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: A rare and deliberate exposure to black widow venom sent a 37-year-old woman to intensive care after she injected a ground-up spider into her bloodstream to get high. Doctors documented severe muscle pain, breathing distress and cardiovascular symptoms, likely intensified by an allergic reaction and an unusually high venom dose. The patient recovered after several days of supportive treatment.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Is Mehek Cooke Indian? The most Googled questions about the Ohio attorney
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Mehek Cooke, an Indian-born Republican lawyer and strategist, is gaining national attention for her outspoken views on Medicaid fraud and conservative policy. Raised in Ohio, Cooke's dual heritage and prominent media presence spark discussions about identity and political alignment within the Republican party, particularly concerning immigration and cultural debates.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: From Olympics to underworld: $40 million motorcycle collection of FBI?s most wanted fugitive Ryan Wedding seized
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Mexican authorities, in a major bust, seized a $40 million collection of luxury motorcycles believed to belong to former Olympian Ryan Wedding. The Canadian national, now on the FBI's Most Wanted list, is accused of running a vast cocaine trafficking operation. This seizure marks a significant blow to his alleged criminal network as the international manhunt intensifies.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: ?Convert your grandfather first?: Nalin Haley criticised for urging Netanyahu to attend Catholic Mass
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Nalin Haley's call for Israeli PM Netanyahu to attend Catholic Mass sparked backlash, with critics citing his family's Sikh roots and Nikki Haley's past "Finish them" message on artillery. The controversy highlights debates on Christian nationalism and religion's role in diplomacy, with accusations of performative religiosity and selective moral signaling.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Super rare case: 17 year old teen wakes from knee surgery speaking only foreign language
items.author: TOI Trending Desk
items.description: A 17-year-old boy in the Netherlands temporarily lost the ability to speak his native Dutch after waking from knee surgery, communicating only in English. Doctors diagnosed the rare condition as foreign language syndrome, a poorly understood phenomenon sometimes linked to anaesthesia. The episode resolved on its own within days, adding to a very small number of documented cases worldwide.

items.title: Happy New Year 2026: 30+ Wishes, images, greetings, quotes and more
items.author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
items.description: As 2026 approaches, the article highlights the diverse ways people celebrate and express New Year's wishes. It emphasizes the value of simple, heartfelt messages, relatable quotes, and genuine status updates, alongside visual elements like images and wallpapers, to connect with loved ones during this transitional period.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Kumail Nanjiani responds to viral rumor of affair with Michelle Obama
items.author: TOI Trending Desk
items.description: Kumail Nanjiani has addressed an internet rumour claiming he was having an affair with Michelle Obama, calling it absurd and false. Speaking on the So True podcast, he said the claim even reached his wife, Emily V. Gordon, despite the fact he has never met Obama. Nanjiani treated the episode with humour while firmly shutting it down.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Silicon Valley ?on the menu?: Trump?s AI czar David Sacks issues warning to big tech
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: David Sacks, Trump's AI and crypto advisor, warns Silicon Valley faces repercussions for its past political funding of left-leaning causes. He argues that years of financial support for progressive initiatives have not shielded the tech industry from rising populist anger, increased regulation, and new tax proposals.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Why Karoline Leavitt?s pregnancy is so rare in American ? and world politics
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Karoline Leavitt's quiet announcement of her second pregnancy highlights the unusual intersection of political power and motherhood. While pregnancy is common, its open presence in high office remains rare, exposing how political systems often penalize bodies requiring flexibility. This moment underscores the slow adaptation of institutions to realities millions navigate daily.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: After the storm: Barron Trump spotted at Mar-a-Lago weeks after Tate-linked controversy and manosphere scrutiny
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Barron Trump made a rare public appearance at Mar-a-Lago's Christmas gathering, weeks after reports linked him to figures associated with controversial online personalities. Seen with family, his sighting follows a New York Times expos? detailing his reported friendship with an influencer connected to the Tate brothers, who face serious allegations.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: With days left on Baba Vanga?s 2025 alien prediction, scientists explain what first contact would look like
items.author: TOI Science Desk
items.description: A new hypothesis from Columbia University astrophysicist David Kipping suggests humanity?s first sign of alien life won?t be a greeting, but evidence of collapse. Drawing on astronomy?s detection bias, he argues we?re most likely to notice civilisations at their loudest and most unstable moments, not at their peak, a bleak twist on decades of first-contact expectations.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Mora Namdar's net worth, education and love life: What to know about Trump's new Secretary for Consular Affairs
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Mora Namdar, an Iranian-American lawyer and beauty salon owner, takes on a key role in the Trump administration. She will now lead the Bureau of Consular Affairs, overseeing vital services like visas and passports. Namdar's appointment follows her previous roles within the State Department and the US Agency for Global Media.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Why Will Byers? gay confession has MAGA viewers fuming and Stranger Things fans split
items.author: TOI Entertainment Desk
items.description: Stranger Things' final season faced backlash for Will Byers' coming-out scene, criticized for its timing and perceived narrative interruption. While some defended it as crucial for Will's character arc and weakening Vecna, many viewers felt it stalled the apocalypse for a monologue they already understood, leading to accusations of forced messaging.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Meet Jayshree Ullal: Indian-origin billionaire at the top of Hurun's rich list
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, leads India's richest tech executives for 2025. She has surpassed Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella. Ullal's net worth is $5.7 billion. Her company's revenue was $7 billion in 2024. The AI and software services boom has boosted her wealth. Ullal is an exemplary leader in a male-dominated industry. Read here to know more!

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: NFL argument turns fatal: Florida man kills wife, shoots stepdaughter in the face, then himself after football match dispute
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: A Florida man, fueled by alcohol and an NFL game dispute, fatally shot his wife and critically wounded his teenage stepdaughter before taking his own life. The 12-year-old son escaped to a neighbor's, hearing the gunshots. Authorities found a note from the wife urging him to seek help for substance abuse. The surviving children are safe with grandparents.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: ?People will die??: Elon Musk slams Zohran Mamdani?s appointment of first openly gay FDNY commissioner
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Elon Musk criticized Zohran Mamdani's appointment of Lillian Bonsignore as FDNY commissioner, warning of potential public safety risks. Musk argued that proven firefighting experience is crucial for leadership, while supporters highlight Bonsignore's extensive EMS background and managerial expertise. The debate centers on whether direct firefighting experience or broader emergency management is more vital for the role.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: California?s tech exodus: Entrepreneur warns of a deeper political crisis as tax losses ?hit $200 billion?
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Tech mogul Chamath Palihapitiya warns California faces a deepening crisis as major companies depart, costing billions in lost tax revenue. He blames a hostile political climate towards innovation, citing Elon Musk's move to Texas. Palihapitiya argues this exodus weakens the state's job market and tax base, urging reforms to avoid severe financial stress.

items.feedTitle: US News Headlines, Latest USA News, US news live on Times of India
items.title: Meet Mora Namdar: Trump appoints beauty salon owner to oversee US passport and visa approvals
items.author: TOI World Desk
items.description: Mora Namdar, a Texas-based beauty salon owner and former government official, has been appointed Assistant Secretary of State for Consular Affairs. This influential role grants her significant control over US passport issuance and visa approvals. Namdar previously served in a similar capacity and has ties to Project 2025, a conservative policy initiative.
